column3: The logic here is too complicated for it's own sake, but I think you're wrong here. 0 threads means 0 threads. No "script verification threads" are created.\n

Damn right, my initial thoughts were that they HAVE to be checked anyway, so 0 threads makes no sense. But without threads just means we do it directly in the function and not in separate threads right?\n
@laanwj I know it's minor, but reworked it to be more clear. You are free to accept this pull or just want to close it.\n

Yes, "0 threads" means that verification is done in the caller thread. But I don't think it's worth changing this code for, sorry. We're already overworked, let's try to keep down on the number of unnecessary changes.\n
